message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of blind detection of orthogonal space-time block codes (OSTBCs) over a quasi-static flat multiple-input multiple-output Rayleigh fading channel. This problem falls under the domain of information theory (cs.IT) as it deals with the transmission and reception of information over a noisy channel. The paper also involves statistical analysis and optimization techniques, which are commonly used in the fields of networking and communication (cs.NI). The use of multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) technology in the paper also suggests that it could be categorized under cs.SI (signal processing and analysis). Additionally, the paper involves simulation studies, which could be categorized under cs.MM (multimedia). Finally, the paper proposes an iterative algorithm for detection, which could be categorized under cs.LG (machine learning).
